javadoc:
A model that provides access to table columns that are "configurable," whether by way of 
 {@link Settings} object, or by the implementations and how they were written (like supplying 
 custom renderers and such).

methods.name: getColumnSettings
methods.comment: Returns settings for the specified column index.

methods.name: getColumnSettingsDefinitions
methods.comment: Returns settings definitions for the specified column index.

methods.name: setColumnSettings
methods.comment:
A convenience method to set bulk column setting information for a group of columns at one
 time (this saves repeated rebuilding when settings are changing for multiple columns at
 once).

params.name: newSettings
params.comment:
A list of pair objects that contain the column index of the column to
        which the new settings apply and the new settings object.

methods.name: setAllColumnSettings
methods.comment:
Allows for the bulk setting of Settings.  This prevents excessive event 
 notification when all settings need to be changed.

params.name: settings
params.comment:
An array of Settings that contains Settings for each column  
        where the index of the Settings in the array is the index of the column
        in the model.

methods.name: getMaxLines
methods.comment:
Gets the maximum number of text display lines needed for any given cell within the 
 specified column.

return.comment: maximum number of lines needed for specified column

name: ConfigurableColumnTableModel
comment:
A model that provides access to table columns that are "configurable," whether by way of 
 Settings object, or by the implementations and how they were written (like supplying 
 custom renderers and such).
